security_audit.summary: This skill is safe to publish. All static findings are false positives. The skill contains only documentation and instructional text to guide Claude Code on error handling best practices. No executable code, network calls, file system operations, or security vulnerabilities were found.

content.user_title: Implement Robust Error Handling in Your Code
content.value_statement: Managing errors in production code is complex and error-prone. This skill guides Claude Code to implement comprehensive error handling with specific exception types, centralized error management, graceful degradation, and proper resource cleanup.
actual_capabilities: Guides implementation of custom exception classes for specific error scenarios
Helps create centralized error handling at appropriate boundaries like controllers and API layers
Provides guidance on implementing retry strategies with exponential backoff for external services
Assists with proper resource cleanup in finally blocks for file handles and database connections
Helps implement graceful degradation for non-critical service failures
Guides fail-fast validation and precondition checks in code
limitations: Does not automatically detect existing error handling patterns in your codebase
Requires manual application to existing code through prompts
Does not provide language-specific error handling libraries or frameworks

use_cases.title: API Error Handling
use_cases.description: Implement centralized error handling for REST API endpoints with appropriate HTTP status codes and user-friendly error messages.

use_cases.title: Service Integration Error Management
use_cases.description: Handle external service failures with retry strategies, circuit breakers, and graceful degradation for third-party integrations.

use_cases.title: Resource Management
use_cases.description: Ensure proper cleanup of database connections, file handles, and network resources in finally blocks to prevent resource leaks.

prompt_templates.prompt: Add retry logic with exponential backoff to the external API call in the fetchUserData function

prompt_templates.title: Centralized Error Handler
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a centralized error handler for the Express API that logs errors appropriately and returns user-friendly messages

output_examples.input: Add error handling to the saveFile function
output_examples.output: I will add comprehensive error handling to the saveFile function with specific exception types, proper resource cleanup in a finally block, and user-friendly error messages while logging technical details for debugging.

output_examples.input: Implement retry logic for the database connection
output_examples.output: I will implement retry logic with exponential backoff for the database connection, distinguishing between transient failures that should be retried and permanent failures that should fail fast.

best_practices: Use this skill when implementing error handling in new features to ensure consistent error management
Apply the skill guidance when refactoring existing error handling to centralize scattered try-catch blocks
Reference this skill when reviewing code to ensure proper resource cleanup and graceful degradation
anti_patterns: Do not use this skill to automatically fix all error handling issues without reviewing the generated code
Avoid applying error handling patterns without understanding the specific failure modes of your system
Do not implement retry logic for operations that are not idempotent without additional safeguards

faq.question: Does this skill automatically add error handling to my existing code?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides guidance to Claude Code when you request error handling implementation through prompts. You must explicitly ask Claude Code to add or improve error handling in specific parts of your code.

faq.question: What programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: The error handling principles in this skill are language-agnostic and can be applied to any programming language that supports exception handling mechanisms.

faq.question: Will this skill help with logging errors?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill includes guidance on logging errors appropriately while protecting sensitive information and providing sufficient detail for debugging.

faq.question: Can this skill help implement circuit breakers?
faq.answer: This skill provides guidance on graceful degradation and retry strategies. While it covers error handling patterns, you may need to explicitly request circuit breaker implementation.

faq.question: Does this skill work with async and await error handling?
faq.answer: Yes, the error handling principles apply to both synchronous and asynchronous code patterns including async and await constructs.

faq.question: How does this skill differ from language-specific error handling libraries?
faq.answer: This skill provides conceptual guidance and best practices rather than specific library implementations. It helps Claude Code understand error handling principles that can be implemented using your chosen language and libraries.
